speaker: Forest
line: The canopy knits itself closed above you. Every path looks familiar until you try to return.

speaker: Cursed Hunter Edrin
line: Don’t step on the pale roots. They listen. And if they like your story, they’ll keep it.

speaker: Cursed Hunter Edrin
line: You want a straight path? You need a soul-guide. I can be that—if you cut the thread tying me to this place.

choices.text: No. I don’t trust bargains in the dark.

speaker: Cursed Hunter Edrin
line: A name. That’s the thread. Someone spoke mine into the trees and the trees refused to let go. If you hear it whispered, don’t answer.

speaker: Forest
line: Somewhere deeper, a branch creaks with the patience of a trap. The forest is not hostile. It’s curious.
